intro: Pilosella bauhini subsp. anisoclada, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish to white composite flowers that bloom in summer. It is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Pilosella bauhini subsp. anisoclada is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
